question_text: Why are Type 2 hypervisors generally considered less suitable for enterprise production environments?
answer_options: They lack support for guest operating systems
They can't run more than one VM at a time
They depend on a host OS, which adds performance and security limitations
They do not allow access to local storage devices
correct_answer: They depend on a host OS, which adds performance and security limitations
explanation: Type 2 hypervisors rely on a full OS to function, adding overhead and risk in enterprise-grade deployment.
